# Air Battle Over Lampang

The Air Battle Over Lampang () was an air-to-air combat between the Royal Thai Air Force (RTAF) and the United States Army Air Force (USAAF) on 11 November 1944 during the Second World War. The engagement took place near Lampang Airfield in northern Thailand, which was used by Thai and Japanese forces as a strategic airbase during the war.
Background
Lampang Airfied was established on 7 November 1923. It was later operated by Royal Thai Air Force (RTAF). In March 1940, the United States Department of War listed Lampang Airfied as a military landing ground.
Following Japan's invaded of Thailand in 1941, Lampang Airfied was occupied and used by Imperial Japanese Army Air Force (IJAAF). The airfied became part of the Lampang Airfield Complex,serving as a strategic node in the network supporting Japanese military operations in northern Thailand and Burma. Throughout the war,the airfield was subjected to Allied air attacks.
In 1944,during Allied reconnaissance and bombing mission over Thailand, the Royal Thai Air Force (RTAF) began deploying aircraft to intercepting Allied plane. These air-to-air combat later become known as Air Battle Over Lampang.
Air battle
On 11 November 1944, At 09:15 (GMT+8) the 51st Fighter Wing of the USAAF send eight P-38J Lightning from 449th Fighter Squadron and nine P-51C Mustang from 25th Fighter Squadron takeoff from Yunnanyi Airfied to northern Thailand.Their mission was an offensive reconnaissance mission. At railway line between Chiang Mai and the Ban Dara bridge. Shortly after takeoff, P-38 Lightning aircraft number 327, flown by 1st Lieutenant Russell Robertson, experienced engine failure and was forced to abort the mission and return to base. This reduced the formation to 16 aircraft that continued with the mission.
Flight 1 P-51C was assigned to fly at low altitude and offensive reconnaissance.
* Flight leader: Lt Col John C. Habecker
* No 2: 2Lt Cardin
* No 3: Capt Meadows
* No 4: Capt Taboor
Flight 2 P-51C was assigned to fly at medium altitude and perform escort missions.
* Flight leader: 1Lt Roger R. Vadenais
* No 2: 2Lt Henry Francis Minco
* No 3: 1Lt Otto C. Miller
* No 4: 1Lt Raubinger
Flight 3 P-38J (No 4 is P-51C) was assigned to fly at high altitude and escort missions.
* Flight leader: Capt Dale D. Desper
* No 2: 2Lt Leonard W. flomer
* No 3: 1Lt Frederick A. Roll, Jr
* No 4: 1Lt Clell H. Mckinney
Flight 4 P-38J was assigned to fly at high altitude and escort missions.
* Flight leader: 1Lt Richard D. Conway
* No 2: 2Lt Joseph N. Fodor
* No 3:1Lt Grover W. Stubby
* No 4:1Lt Robert H. Jones
At 11:15-12:10 (GMT+7), Squadron 41 Group of the 80th Composite Wing scrambled 5 Curtiss Hawk III fighters in an attempt to intercept the enemy formation. However, the interception failed as the Allied aircraft were flying at an extremely high altitude, beyond the operational ceiling of the Hawk III fighters.
At 11:30 (GMT+7), Group of the 85th  received intelligence about the incoming USAAF formation and scrambled 2 fighters KI-27b from Squadron 16.The Two RTAF pilots, led by  Pilot Officer Kamrop Plengkham and Flight Sergeant Third Class Chuladit Detkunchorn fly to Phan District and Muang Ngao District. However they did not sight any Allied aircraft and returned to base.
At 12:11-12:31 (GMT+7), allied aircraft arrival at lampang Airfied.The Royal Thai Air Force (RTAF)scrambled send  3 KI-27b  from Squadron 16 lead by Squadron Leader Chalermkiat Watanangura , Acting Pilot Officer Waat Suntornkomol and Flight Sergeant Third Class Thada Biaokhaimuk to intercept. During the engaged between Flight 3 and Squadron Leader Chalermkiat in a head-on attack. Both sides exchanged fire at an altitude of 15,000 feet. Gunfire from Squadron Leader Chalermkiat's aircraft struck the right wing fuel tank of 2nd Lieutenant Folmer's plane, causing it to catch fire. He was forced to break off from combat, with Capt Dale D. Desper escorting him as his wingman back to Yunnanyi Airfied.
Meanwhile, Squadron Leader Chalermkiat's aircraft sustained damage when enemy fire struck and dislodged the engine cowling, damaging the engine and forcing him to make an emergency landing at Lampang Airfield. Squadron Leader Chalermkiat was wounded by gunfire that struck his right leg. He was rescued by ground crew members before Allied aircraft flew by Lt Col John C. Habecker strafed his abandoned plane, causing it to explode.
Acting Pilot Officer Waat Suntornkomol aircraft also got hit during engagement the aircraft caught fire.Acting Pilot Waat Suntornkomal was forced to bailout He sustained critical burn injuries and was rescued by local civilians and transported him to hospital. However,he died from his injuries. Meanwhile Pilot Officer Kamrop Plengkham and  Flight Sergeant Third Class Chuladit Detkunchorn come back from intercept and join air battle. Flight Sergeant Third Class Chuladit Detkunchorn got hit at right wing. He try to land at lampang Airfied but failed to land his plane flipped over. He had been injured but survived.  Flight Sergeant Third Class Thada Biaokhaimuk got hit by an engine and landed safely in a rice field.Last pilot is Pilot Officer Kamrop Plengkham got chased by P-51 fly by Lt Henry Minco. Kamrop lure the enemy to fly low because P-51 is a high speed plane Henry fly pass KI-27b to avoid hit mountain.As Lt Minco pull up. The P-51 entered Kamrop Gunsight. Kamrop fired hitting at P-51.His plane crashed into mountain.
Aftermath
After this battle, KI-27b flown by Pilot Officer Kamrop Plengkham was also damaged, attempted to landing at lampang Airfied however he saw P-38J fly near Airfied, He decided to change landing at Koh Kha Airfied.
For their actions during the battle, Acting Pilot Officer Waat Suntornkomol,Flight Sergeant Thada Biaokhaimuk and Flight Sergeant Third Class Chuladit Detkunchorn receive Bravery Medal. For Flight Lieutenant Chalermkiat Watanangura and  Pilot Officer Kamrop Plengkham receive Chaiyaphruek Cluster attached to the ribbon of the Bravery Medal.
